messages.message:
Has anyone figured out how to use typing (not mypy comments) with opencv/cv2?

I think most of our codebase uses mypy comments with `cv2.ImageType=np._ArrayLike[Any]`, but I’m pretty sure this `ImageType` isn’t something actually built into cv2, so when I try to use it, I get that `ImageType` doesn’t exist on the module. If I use `np._ArrayLike[Any]`, I get that it doesn’t exist on `np`. And if I use `np.ndarray` (which is what it actually is), I get “Argument <n> to “<function_name>” has incompatible type “_ArrayLike[Any]“; expected “ndarray[Any]“” for each time I use it
we’d have to go and change our mypy typing stubs i believe to get this working properly. maybe there’s another way?
hmm… at least one of those seems like it should work. what does the code look like?

it doesn’t work because we created `_ArrayLike[Any]` as a fake type (it doesn’t actually exist in numpy) but `np.ndarray` does but won’t work as valid typing since our mypy stubs don’t expect that type
maybe we could redefine `_ArrayLike[Any]` as an alias of `np.ndarray`?
